name: The George at Nunney

reviews.text: I recently paid my second visit to this lovely pub/hotel. My daughter has just moved to the area and she treated my husband and I plus her partners parents to dinner. It was a lovely relaxed evening with superb food. The service was excellent and there was a good choice of courses. We would definitely return as we love the ambience of the George and were made to feel ver welcome.
reviews.title: Superb food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here on a Saturday night with my girlfriend whilst visiting Wincanton racecourse before in the afternoon. The bar and restaurant area is intimate and stylish with comfy leather sofa's and soft lighting and of good condition. Our room was snug, cosy and well decorated with the bathroom being clean with hot running water and a good size bath. We enjoyed and had no complaints with our evening meal and again the same with our full English breakfast. The staff were fantastic offering friendly helpful service with a smile. We would definitely return and t thoroughly recommend.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good food and accomodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd like to be able to tell you about the food. And I'd like to be able to tell you about the atmosphere. But I can't tell you about either. We visited Nunney today and intended to have a small meal in the The George. On arrival, my husband told the woman behind the bar that we would be ordering food, but her immediate response was to inform us that there would be a very long wait. This inn has a lot of tables but we couldn't see any more than about 15 people or so sitting around. There were far more empty tables than customers. So I asked how long could we realistically expect to wait....she didn't exactly give us a straight answer but instead mumbled about having one x table of 5 people waiting and one x table of 6 people waiting. Okay, I'm no Carol Vorderman but even I can calculate that that's a grand total of 11 people.....which is not very many. When I asked whether even sandwiches would be a long wait, she sniffily replied that they 'don't do sandwiches' and pointed us towards a cafe elsewhere in Nunney.
reviews.title: A waste of time

reviews.text: I can see from a previous review that a long wait seems to be par for the course here, so perhaps they need to rethink their kitchen staff. And I find it extraordinary that they would allow business to drift away.....but right from the off the woman behind the bar seemed to want to deliberately put us off. And to send us away to another establishment strikes me as business suicide. Though I have to say they probably did us a favour because the cafe was brilliant.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: It's a lovely old inn with a lot of history but I have my doubts that the current owners will be making much of an impression in the inn's history unless they pull their finger out and aim to please rather than aim to deter.
reviews.title: Lovely Room and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for one night in September while visiting family. This is the first time I had visited the pub since 1985 and I could not believe the transformation! It has been refurbished to a very high standard. It feels like an upmarket wine bar with a relaxing atmosphere. In addition it is located in a really picturesque village. There was a slight mix up with our dinner reservation but the staff rectified this really quickly. The food (both evening and breakfast) was excellent and the room was really comfortable. We will certainly be staying here again in the future.
reviews.title: Wow what a transformation

reviews.text: Folks. If you are in and around wiltshire or somerset this is the place to stay. Rooms are very good. Bar and restaurant are what yoi would expect a smal country hotel to be. The staff are fandabydosey. A special mention for the food - top notch. Please visit. Kenny from uganda
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.text: If I could refurbish an old Inn and blend modern hospitality with historic accommodation I would want it to be like the George.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great last minute rate, called 2pm from London and was down for tea. , you'll have to call yourself to find out.
reviews.title: Friendly people

reviews.text: We arrived on the monday afternoon and were welcomed by a friendly member of staff with the news we had beenupgraded to the Trafalgar room. What a delightful setting, with a four poster, window seat, leather sofa and a view of Nunney castle. The room was fully equipped with TV and DVD, films available free from reception. There was a generous supply of tea and biscuits and a large bathroom with shower. The owners intend to update the shower and tiling in the near future. Our stay was truly relaxing as thepub has a good restaurant and adequate range of ales and some lovely wines. The owners are extremely friendly and helpful andwere more than willing to chat at breakfast and made sure that we were completely happy.
reviews.title: Great food, excellent accommodation and superb service

reviews.text: I've just returned from the most fantastic stay at this beautifully tasteful hotel.
reviews.title: Stunningly atmospheric hotel with amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were warm and friendly, the decor is that of a 'boutique' type hotel mixing modern (yet earthy) with the beautiful limestone walls.
reviews.title: 1 Night Stay
Romantic hideaway
reviews.text: The lighting in the bar/restaurant area makes the whole place very cosy, homely and inviting, especially with the beautiful old features. The vibe in the evening was fabulous and the food superb! I'm a huge fish fan, so ate a delicious scallop starter with a sweet sauce and rocket salad followed by a meaty piece of hake with a pine nut and sundried tomato salad... All topped with yet another the flavoursome sauce!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were beautifully furnished, clean and full
reviews.title: Lovely position and downstairs bar/restaurant area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of character. Ours had views across the prettiest steam overlooking the old castle remains.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel,lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight on our way to Hampshire and found this small hotel very good . Staff were very good , the evening meal excellent but the breakfast although good was not the same standard. The room was good and the public areas are exceptional .Overall a very good stay
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The impression we formed by reading previous reviews on here was that the George was strong on its reputation for good food. This is completely true as far as we are concerned as we dined on both nights of our stay as well as the breakfasts had were of a very high quality. Saturday was a busy night with an 18th birthday party going on in the b/fast conference room (which was low key ) and yet our orders came in a reasonable time and the service was excellent. We had the anti pasti starter to share which is huge and came on a wooden board and was delicious . Then both of us tried the 10 oz ribeye and again it was mouth watering and by this time we were feeling very full to say the least. Sunday nights choice was the Greek starter on the aforementioned board and the main was the lamb cutlets with beautiful presentation. The value of our room plus everything else means we will stay again without question.
reviews.title: Gastro-tastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this small hotel as we were attending a party in Frome. The hotel is delighful and we had a very pleasant room with everything you needed supplied. The staff are welcoming and helpful and the breakfast freshly cooked and of a high standard. Looking forward to a return visit.
reviews.title: Over night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had just been at Centerparcs in Longleat and wanted to stay an extra night so that we could visit the safari park the next day, so we booked into a hotel. The village of Nunney is very pretty and the hotel itself is a lovely old building. Inside it is modernised, clean and fresh, without destroying the old nature of the building. It's not a stylish place but it is well-kept. The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable. It was excellent value for money too.
reviews.title: Friendly place to stay

reviews.text: This beautiful little village is definatley complimented by the George hotel. They could not do enough to help us even though they were clearly very busy with a wedding they were helpful sociable and happy to answer any question we had.we have stayed at many many 5 star places but this place I would rated over & above.
reviews.title: Beautiful.scenic amazing service & staff!

description: The George at Nunney is an 17th century coaching Inn in the village of Nunney, in Somerset. The Inn is a firm favourite with locals, regulars and travelers alike and has established itself with a reputation for fine food, great service and a relaxing ambiance enhanced with open fires and sandstone walls.The bar, lounge and restaurant areas are all recently refurbished with great character, featuring exposed beams and large open fireplaces. The gardens are a haven for those who enjoy drinking or dining 'al fresco'.We have 9 spacious rooms, all with en-suite bathrooms, and tea/coffee making facilities and a hairdryer and Television. A full locally sourced and acclaimed English breakfast is included in the price of our rooms.
